text: Railroad Wash is a seasonal stream or wash and a tributary of the Gila River. Its mouth is at its confluence with the Gila River, at an elevation of 3,839 feet / 1,170 meters. Its source is located at an elevation of 4,237 feet on the west side of the Summit Hills, in Hidalgo County, New Mexico, at . ==References== Railroad Wash (Gila River) Category:Rivers of Arizona Railroad Wash (Gila River) Category:Rivers of New Mexico
title: Railroad Wash (Gila River tributary)
